result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Rene Navarro was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 4 years bifurcated sentence.
Consecutive to: to 15CF578

superMiscConds.notes: No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.

Provide DNA sample as required by law and pay assessed surcharge.  Pay costs of supervision and court obligations.  Obey all rules and regulations of supervising agent.  Cooperate with counseling, treatment and programs determined appropriate.  Follow through with recommendations.  No contact with Samantha Weiss.  No contact with victims.  If undergoing any type of medical procedure, defendant is to inform physicians that he has had an opiate issue.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.  Firearm prohibition warning given.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Rene Navarro

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael Rene Navarro in court with attorney Kathleen Renee Lang.  Defendant Michael Rene Navarro in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The State is in compliance w/Ch. 950. Parties have reviewed PSI as well as the letter provided today by Ms. Lang Muffitt. Deft is stipulating to restitution. No additions or corrections noted by parties. 15cf578-6 yrs bifurated as 3/3, 15CF1624-4 yrs WPS bifurcated as 2/2, consec and in 15CF11-consec probation.

BTC: 15CF578-Total sentence is 6 yrs WPS bifurcated as 3 yrs IC, 3 yrs ES/CFTS
         15CF11-On both counts, total sentence is 4 yrs WPS bifurcated as 2 yrs IC, 2 yrs ES - STAYED. 3 yrs probation, consec to time being served. If probation is revoked, the time will be consec.
         15CF1624-Total sentence is 4 yrs WPS bifurcated as 2 yrs IC, 2 yrs ES, consec to 15CF578

Conditions
obey all rules and regs
restitution $1529.02 to ECU in 15CF578
costs
DNA sample if not already provided & costs
no alc/cs except by Rx-UA's
any counseling deemed approp by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care
FT emp
no contact with Samantha Weiss
no contact with victims
if deft undergoes any type of medical procedures, deft is to inform physicians that he has had an opiate issue

FAW/vote

IS eligible for CIP and SAP AFTER 2 YEARS OF CONFINEMENT

Defendant Michael Rene Navarro in court with attorney Kathleen Renee Lang.  Defendant Michael Rene Navarro in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The State is in compliance with Ch. 950. Upon pl to 15CF578-State recommends 3 yrs IC, 3 yrs ES. In 15CF11, pl to Cts 1 & 2, balance are DRI. State recommends consec probation. In 15CF566 is DRI. In 15CF1624, Pl to Ct 1, balance DRI. State recommends 4 yrs WPS cons bifurcated as 2 yrs IC, 2 yrs ES.
P-G to all above
COP filed, rights given
the deft waives right to JT
the State relies on comp for FB - defense stipulates to same
finding of guilt

BTC: guilty as above. PSI ordered  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 21, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Michael Rene Navarro in court with attorney Kathleen Renee Lang.  Defendant Michael Rene Navarro in custody.  W Richard Chiapete appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Michael Rene Navarro in court with attorney Gretchen G. Rosenke.  Defendant Michael Rene Navarro in custody.  Brian Van Schyndel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Lori Thornton.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Warrant forwarded to RCSO for entry
